member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerFx.Connectors.CachingHttpClient
member.summary: Simple cache for GETs. Cache is reset when a POST is made.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerFx.Connectors.OpenApiExtensions.GetContentTypeAndSchema(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,Microsoft.OpenApi.Models.OpenApiMediaType})
member.summary: Identifies which ContentType and Schema to use.
member.returns: RequestBody content dictionary of possible content types and associated schemas.
member.exception: When we cannot determine the content type to use.

member.name: T:Microsoft.PowerFx.Connectors.PowerPlatformConnectorClient
member.summary: Http handler to invoke Power Platform connectors. This accepts HttpRequestMessages described the swagger, transforms the request, and forwards them to Connector endpoints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerFx.Connectors.PowerPlatformConnectorClient.GetAuthToken
member.summary: Callback to get the auth token. Invoke as a callback since token may need to be refreshed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.PowerFx.ConfigExtensions.AddService(Microsoft.PowerFx.PowerFxConfig,System.String,Microsoft.OpenApi.Models.OpenApiDocument,System.Net.Http.HttpMessageInvoker,Microsoft.PowerFx.Connectors.ICachingHttpClient)
member.summary: Add functions for each operation in the . Functions names will be 'functionNamespace.operationName'. Functions are invoked via rest via the httpClient. The client must handle authentication.
member.param: Config to add the functions to.
An API document. This can represent multiple formats, including Swagger 2.0 and OpenAPI 3.0.
Required iff we want to invoke the API. A client to invoke the endpoints described in the api document. This must handle auth or any other tranforms the API expects.
A cache to avoid redundant HTTP gets.
